moves.1. e4 e5 2. Bc4 Bc5 3. Ne2: in order to mowe f4 after castle
moves.3... Bxf2+:
surprise ! 
i didnt expect this risky sacrifice, i'll try to move the king in g1 after eat this agresive bishop
moves.5... Nxe4+ 6. Kg1: no matter loosing this pawn, castle was more important, now i can develop
moves.6... O-O 7. d3 d5 8. Bb3: i have to keep this treat on f7
moves.8... Nc5: anoiding knight, i'll try to go on treatening f7 whith the queen after Kc5 x Bb3
moves.9. c3 Bg4:
surprise, it' becoming hard for white
but it give me a oportunity to keep my white bishop whith Bc3 c2
moves.10. Bc2 d4 11. Nd2:
i dont take the d4 paw because i prefer he do it 
... - d4 x c3
b2 x c3 - ...
Bc3 !
moves.11... dxc3 12. bxc3 Nxd3: i have to eat it, to dangerous
moves.13. Bxd3 Qxd3: that was sure ! but i found a response whith Bf3, if he take it then i take it back whith the rook a treat the black queen
moves.14. Nf3 Qg6 15. Nxe5 Qb6+: this is not very interesting move ...
moves.16... Bxe2 17. Qxe2:
this exchange was not very interesting also for black, it shows that they have no more plans
so a good oportunity to regain the initiative
moves.17... Re8:
it seems to be a good move for blacks ...
but did they saw Qc4 ! treatening mate in f7 ?
moves.18... Re6:
it whould be preferable to move the rook back to f8
but most of the time, people dont like to move back, a bad question of ego
moves.20... Rae8: NO ! the danger for blacks is Kf7 g5 !
moves.21. Ng5 Ne5:
good, but not enought : 
23. Qd5 - surely c6 ignoring the treate of the f1 rook whith the a3 bishop ...
moves.22. Qd5 c6: that was sure, this is the danger in blitz games
moves.23... Rxf8 24. Qxe6+ Nf7 25. Bxf8 Qd8 26: It was nive, but if somebody know about the opening, thanks in advance !
